title: Be a hero
descHtml: For my 2nd semester exam project, I worked along side two fellow students, on a website for the coaching company ‘Be a hero’, created by Benthe. She needed a logo and a responsive website, that gives a quick overview of her business, its services, and who she is. We came up with a simple design that is easy to navigate, it is build with HTML, CSS and Vanilla JS. The logo is simple, and comes in multiple versions for scalablility, in wordmark and as a symbol. The symbol I created, we refer to as a ‘cape’. The ‘cape’ is an organic and clean-cut shape, inspired by a lavender flowerpetal, and a superhero cape.
EXdescHtml: For my 2nd semester exam project, I worked along side two fellow students, on the website for ‘Be a hero’. A coaching company started in September 2021, by Benthe, with years of experience in the field. She already has an established customer base, but needed a responsive website, that gives a quick overview of her, her business, and its services. Furthermore, she needed a logo, and a cover photo for her LinkedIn business page. We came up with a simple design that is easy to navigate, it is build with HTML, CSS and Vanilla JS. The logo is simple, and comes in multiple versions, for scalablility. To go with, I created what we refer to as a ‘cape’. The ‘cape’ is an organic, but clean-cut icon, inspired by a lavender flowerpetal, and a superhero cape.
shortHtml: For my 2nd semester exam project, I worked along side two fellow students, on the website for ‘Be a hero’. A coaching company started in September 2021, by Benthe, with years of experience in the field. She already has an established customer base, but needed a responsive website, that gives a quick overview of her, her business, and its services...

title: TaskRoomies
descHtml: TaskRoomies is a web app for roommates, dorms and other cohabitants. Its purpose is to provide a clear, easy overview of the shared household chores, and thus remove the stress and mental energy of keeping track of who does what when. It also comes with a personal list, to keep track of all your personal to-do's and chores.

title: Personal website v.3.2
descHtml: My personal website/portfolio! This current version is v.3.2 of my portfolio website. The first version, v.1, were made with plain HTML/CSS and vanilla JavaScript. Then, I made v.2 using with WordPress, as an examproject during my 2. semester. Next, is v.3.1 which I made with React and regular CSS, I have since then updated it from CSS to use SCSS which then makes this version, v.3.2! I am almost always doing something to improve my portfolio, with additions, edits and tweaks. In the future, I plan on upgrading my portfolio, from React to Next.

title: Space Debris Inc
descHtml: Space Debris Inc is a project i work on as an intern at AKQA, alongside two other fellow interns, as a part of our intro. Space Debris Inc is a futuristic company, handling waste disposal by launching waste into space, with rockets. It consists of a website with info about the company, including a webshop to order trash pick-ups. It also includes admin-functionality to create or edit rockets as well as launch them according to a time-schedule, as well as a dashboard to view sales-statistics over a day, month or year.
shortHtml: TaskRoomies is a web app for roommates, dorms and other cohabitants. title: Generaxion
descHtml: During my 2nd semester at the business academy, we were given the task of creating and incorporating a job agent prototype, for Generaxions job site, for any interested job seekers to use and apply through, and be notified if an open position suiting them were to be published. Our goal were to make it easy, user-friendly and simple to use. We also needed to create some eye-catching branding for company’s social media platforms, to promote the job agent and reach possible job seekers.

title: Miscellaneous
descHtml:
Besides working on projects as a part of my education, I also experiment and do a lot of programming, designing or illustrating in my spare time, which also helps me learn and expand my knowledge. These are just a few examples of what I have been working on:
A Tic Tac Toe game, some vector illustrations made in illustrator, and an svg, which “draws” when you scroll.
